findings.title: Some important function calls can be front-run using difefrent parameters
findings.description: The system does not offer any protection against front-running, particularly for some important operations such as wallet creation, transaction execution, transaction cancellation, and owner reset.

findings.title: No contract existence check in the TransferHelper library transfer functions
findings.description: The ERC-20 token transfer functions in the TransferHelper library contract do not implement contract existence checks.

findings.title: VWManager allows users to call delegatecall on any contract from their virtual wallets
findings.description: Users can call delegatecall on any contract from their virtual wallets using VWManager

findings.title: Some important operations can revert, causing gas costs to be impossible to reimburse
findings.description: The execute function of the VMManager contract is vulnerable as some important operations can revert, leading to unreimbursable gas costs.

findings.title: Vulnerabilities due to use of outdated Solidity version
findings.description: The Solidity version has been upgraded to 0.8.19, however it is advised to ensure that new opcodes introduced in the updated version are available on all target blockchain networks.

findings.title: Users can create non-executable and non-cancellable orders to drain server node deposits
findings.description: Attackers can create malicious orders which cannot be executed or cancelled, leading to depletion of server node deposits.

findings.title: Denial-of-Service risks on virtual wallet by front-running execute
findings.description: The finding highlights a potential Denial-of-Service risk due to front-running execution on the virtual wallet, which could lead to system unavailability.

findings.title: Unsafe ERC-20 transfer for fee payment
findings.description: The fix for this issue does not include a contract existence check for the `_feeToken` address; if this address does not have a contract deployed, the transaction will still return success even though it did not transfer any tokens.

findings.title: Lack of two-step process for critical operations
findings.description: The system lacks a two-step process for performing critical operations, which can lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Lack of validation of the cross-chain order parameters
findings.description: The `tokenOut` and `amountOut` values are not included in the `payOrderId`, and anyone can execute orders.

findings.title: Anyone can cancel an order to grief users
findings.description: The platform did not restrict anyone from cancelling orders, allowing malicious actors to grief users.

findings.title: Slashing a lot of orders can be very expensive
findings.description: The dappOS team added a minimum refund threshold for server node punishment.

findings.title: Owner can delay operations for certain wallets
findings.description: The owner of a deployed contract still retains control of the source chain configuration, which can lead to delayed operations for certain wallets.

findings.title: Front-running risks on order execution and wallet creation transactions
findings.description: The finding highlights potential front-running risks associated with order execution and wallet creation transactions.
